content: k1 kf&b x 8 24 sts round 3 knit round 4 k2 kf&b x 8 32 sts round 5 knit round 6 k3 kf&b x 8 40 sts darn in the cast on tail of yarn closing the hole your circle should measure roughly 5cm / 2 across although as you can see it won t look circular while it s on the needles the body mark the start of the rounds with a safety pin now a row counter is useful too rounds 1 - 3 knit round 4 k8 ssk k2tog k8 twice 36 sts rounds 5 - 7 knit round 8 k7 ssk k2tog k7 twice 32 sts 3 rounds 9 - 11 knit round 12 k6 ssk k2tog k6 twice 28 sts rounds 13 - 15 knit round 16 k5 ssk k2tog k5 twice 24 sts that s the body finished so you can cut the yarn now position the coin in the middle of the base and then add your bean bag making sure that the knots in the tights are in the middle of the knitting where they will be covered by stuffing and the coin it s much easier to add stuffing if you slide both sets of stitches on to the cable of your needle the second half of the gnome - his hat - is knitted with the lighter shade of yarn you shouldn t need to mark the start of rounds now as the jog where the colours change serves as a marker this will be on the front of the gnome and so will be hidden under his beard rounds 17 - 19 knit round 20 k4 ssk k2tog k4 twice 20 sts rounds 21 - 23 knit round 24 k3 ssk k2tog k3 twice 16sts fold back the knitting and darn in the tails where you changed colour 4 now you can add the first bit of stuffing use small amounts at a time shaping the gnome with your hand as you go the finished gnome should be wider than he is fat more of an oval than a round any lumps can be smoothed by a bit of poking with a knitting needle round 24 rounds 25 - 27 knit round 28 k2 ssk k2tog k2 twice 12 sts add some more stuffing now rounds 29 - 31 knit round 32 k1 ssk k2tog k1 twice 8 sts for the next lot of stuffing i d recommend using tweezers to push small amounts in at a time using a twisting action round 32 5 nearly there now knit one more round and then cut the yarn leaving a longish tail thread the yarn through the remaining eight stitches but don t pull them closed until you ve added one last little bit of stuffing with the tweezers at this point you might like to check the side seams for signs of the stuffing showing through the easiest way to deal with ladders like these is to darn
